channel.title: [PI] Help needed [PI] I will +rep
channel.description: So i dont get any errors in eclipse, not in the console also.. But after a while my players get dced, and it says Your account is already logged in blabla.. Or it just kicks them out instant.. Does anyone know how i can fix this ? Thanks in advance.

item.title: [PI] Help needed [PI] I will +rep
item.dc:creator: @StonedC0D3r StonedC0D3r
item.description:
@StonedC0D3r wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:509562”][quote author=StonedC0D3r link=topic=627807.msg4266510#msg4266510 date=1364099771]

Now it gives me this :
[img]http://puu.sh/2mTKC[/im g]

Move the sign folder into the java folder…

Ok it worked, i don’t get any errors …
[img]http://puu.sh/2mUgO[/img ]

Also got this error in the console when running it with the other ones i mentioned before :
[23/03/13 2:25]: [player-2]: Invalid waypoint in walking queue!
[23/03/13 2:25]: [player-1]: Invalid waypoint in walking queue!
[23/03/13 2:26]: [player-2]: Invalid waypoint in walking queue!
[23/03/13 2:26]: [player-2]: Invalid waypoint in walking queue!

[/quote]
That just means they didn’t click a valid spot on map. it’s fine.[/quote]
Then i really can’t think of what causes the glitch

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help needed [PI] I will +rep
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

StonedC0D3r:

Your compiler gives me the Javac can not be found error

Oh… Yeah… You kind of need to set up classpaths…
Try changing javac to:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_13\bin\javac.exe”
Make sure Program Files is right (it can be “Program Files(x86)”) and make sure your jdk version is right.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help needed [PI] I will +rep

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help needed [PI] I will +rep
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

StonedC0D3r:

Do you have a compiler for clients? I also remember seeing character file not found for like 5 times on the same name when it glitched… After i restart the server the glitch is fixed for a while…

I’d say yes… But well. It depends on how your client files are structured.
I assume you’re using a 317.
So in your client folder. Create a new folder called “Java” and one called “Class” move all the .class files into the folder labeled “Class”, and the .javas (including the sign folder) into the folder labeled “Java”
Here’s the Compile.bat you want:

@echo off
Title Compiler
javac -d ./Class/ Java/*.java Java/sign/*.java
pause

and you’re going to want a new run.bat so replace yours with mine:

@echo off
Title Client
cd ./Class/
START java -Xmx512m client 30 0 lowmem members 32
exit

Read full topic
